awards: **Started writing code at 13 years old**: The first programming language I learned was Ruby.
**I was able to afford and buy my first car before I hit 18**: 2009 Red Chevrolet Optra.
additionalExperience: **[Vuesax RTL Support](https://github.com/lusaxweb/vuesax/pull/659)**: Contributed to the Vuesax UI library by adding RTL support.
**[Turning E-commerce](https://www.turing.com/)**: This is a complete project built by me for turing.com, it was the first assessment of many which I succeeded.
**[Hacktoberrank](https://github.com/paulodiovani/hacktoberrank)**: Contributed to the UI that ranked all participants in [Hacktoberfest](https://hacktoberfest.com/) 2019.

highlights: Led the entire frontend process by selecting technical stacks for projects, working closely with the design team, performing final checks, creating and assigning tasks to teammates, and reviewing PRs/MRs.
Collaborated with the project manager to clarify requirements, discuss business logic, and evaluate technical solutions.
Leveraged frontend principles and architectures, such as Monorepos, components structure (stateless and presentational), unit, integration and end-to-end testing, and CI/CD.
Developed the [Hashtagfox.com](https://hashtagfox.com/) platform using Vue.js with more than **100** components and **100** test cases. Achieved a code coverage of **75%**.
Designed and developed a robust email customer support platform for internal teams using React.js, featuring a user-friendly interface similar to Gmail, utilized by our customer support agents.
Developed and maintained large Node.js-TypeScript based code bases, over **50+** classes, including internal services, third-party services, controllers, and routes.

Designed and developed an internal task manager, with advanced features such as real-time updates and activity logs. Built the frontend using React TypeScript and the backend using Node.js TypeScript, with GCP cloud functions.
Developed over **six** [Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/) landing pages that are SEO ready and have less than one second loading time
Developed multiple payment interfaces using Stripe, utilizing [Stripe elements](https://stripe.com/payments/elements) as well as standalone Stripe integration.
Expert with Firebase's various tools such as Firestore, real-time databases, authentication, hosting, storage, cloud functions, and Node.js SDK.

Created an advanced analytics dashboard, encompassing complex SQL aggregation queries consisting of more than **450 lines**, and developed over **20 queries**. The React.js-based dashboard provided critical insights to the organization, facilitating informed decision-making and leading to over **240k** [app](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/boost-app-social/id1551991915) installs.

Demonstrated proficiency with [Google's Bigquery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery), optimized SQL aggregation queries using data partitioning and clustering, saving **46%** of the cost and accelerating query processing times **by six times.**

Built [GCP cloud functions](https://firebase.google.com/docs/functions/schedule-functions) for different use cases such as webhook integration, saving received events to our Firestore database, and streaming data to Bigquery database, with over **300k** events successfully saved.
Possess average experience writing deployment pipelines using [Ansible](https://www.ansible.com/).
Experience optimizing animation rendering to hit 60 fps

Developed applications in modern workflows with CI\CD pipelines and an iterative building process.

highlights: Joined Corptia as a front-end web developer after being invited by the founders.
Developed a Vue.js boilerplate admin panel, featuring a set of complex components like CRUD-generator component, while prioritizing ease of use, reusability, and performance.
Established a seamless GraphQL-based development workflow, leveraging GraphQL features such as fragments and aliases.
Collaborated closely with the design team and worked closely with the backend team to launch our GraphQL interfaces, and often provided additional help to the backend team.
Provided technical support to the mobile team on using Git and GraphQL.

Worked with top-class developers and learned a lot in a short amount of time.
Completed tasks assigned to me in various projects, which helped me gain extensive knowledge and experience.
